snippet: The four plaintiffs argue that rules on federal subsidies apply only in states that created their own insurance exchanges; their state, Virginia, has not.
abstract: Plaintiffs challenging Affordable Care Act before Supreme Court are arguing that rules on federal subsidies apply only in states that have their own insurance exchanges, not in states that do not; object to not being able to opt out federal health insurance without paying penalties.
lead_paragraph: The four plaintiffs argue that rules on federal subsidies apply only in states that created their own insurance exchanges; their state, Virginia, has not.

headline.main: In Health Law Case, Plaintiffs Dislike Rules on Purchases and Penalties
headline.print_headline: In Health Law Case, Plaintiffs Dislike Rules on Purchases and Penalties

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
